properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the ACL auth method.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of the ACL auth method.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A free form human readable description of the auth method.

properties.name: config
properties.description: (Required) The raw configuration for this ACL auth method.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: auth_method
properties.description: (Required) The name of the ACL auth method this rule apply.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A free form human readable description of the binding rule.

properties.name: selector
properties.description: (Optional) The expression used to math this rule against valid identities returned from an auth method validation.

properties.name: bind_type
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the way the binding rule affects a token created at login.

properties.name: bind_name
properties.description: (Required) The name to bind to a token at login-time.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the policy.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) The description of the policy.

properties.name: rules
properties.description: (Required) The rules of the policy.

properties.name: datacenters
properties.description: (Optional) The datacenters of the policy.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the ACL role.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A free form human readable description of the role.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: (Optional) The list of policies that should be applied to the role.

properties.name: service_identities
properties.description: (Optional) The list of service identities that should be applied to the role.
The service_identities supports:

properties.name: service_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the service.

properties.name: datacenters
properties.description: (Optional) The datacenters the effective policy is valid within.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: accessor_id
properties.description: (Optional) The uuid of the token. If omitted, Consul will generate a random uuid.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) The description of the token.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: (Optional) The list of policies attached to the token.

properties.name: local
properties.description: (Optional) The flag to set the token local to the current datacenter.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: token_id
properties.description: (Required) The id of the token.

properties.name: policy
properties.description: (Required) The name of the policy attached to the token.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Optional) The address of the service. Defaults to the address of the agent.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the service.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Optional) The port of the service.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of values that are opaque to Consul, but can be used to distinguish between services or nodes.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: datacenter
properties.description: • datacenter - (Optional) The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

properties.name: cleanup_dead_servers
properties.description: • cleanup_dead_servers - (Optional) Whether to remove failing servers when a replacement comes online. Defaults to true.

properties.name: last_contact_threshold
properties.description: • last_contact_threshold - (Optional) The time after which a server is considered as unhealthy and will be removed. Defaults to "200ms".

properties.name: max_trailing_logs
properties.description: • max_trailing_logs - (Optional) The maximum number of Raft log entries a server can trail the leader. Defaults to 250.

properties.name: server_stabilization_time
properties.description: • server_stabilization_time - (Optional) The period to wait for a server to be healthy and stable before being promoted to a full, voting member. Defaults to "10s".

properties.name: redundancy_zone_tag
properties.description: • redundancy_zone_tag - (Optional) The redundancy zone tag to use. Consul will try to keep one voting server by zone to take advantage of isolated failure domains. Defaults to an empty string.

properties.name: disable_upgrade_migration
properties.description: • disable_upgrade_migration - (Optional) Whether to disable upgrade migrations. Defaults to false.

properties.name: upgrade_version_tag
properties.description: • upgrade_version_tag - (Optional) The tag to override the version information used during a migration. Defaults to an empty string.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Required) The address of the node being added to, or referenced in the catalog.

properties.name: node
properties.description: • node - (Required) The name of the node being added to, or referenced in the catalog.

properties.name: service
properties.description: • service - (Optional) A service to optionally associated with the node. Supported values are documented below.

properties.name: datacenter
properties.description: • datacenter - (Optional) The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

properties.name: token
properties.description: • token - (Optional) ACL token.
The service block supports the following:

properties.name: address
properties.description: (Optional) The address of the service. Defaults to the node address.

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the service. Defaults to the name.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the service

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Optional) The port of the service.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A list of values that are opaque to Consul, but can be used to distinguish between services or nodes.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: kind
properties.description: • kind - (Required) The kind of configuration entry to register.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the configuration entry being registred.

properties.name: config_json
properties.description: • config_json - (Optional) An arbitrary map of configuration values.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: source_name
properties.description: • source_name - (Required, string) The name of the source service for the intention. This service does not have to exist.

properties.name: destination_name
properties.description: • destination_name - (Required, string) The name of the destination service for the intention. This service does not have to exist.

properties.name: action
properties.description: • action - (Required, string) The intention action. Must be one of allow or deny.

properties.name: meta
properties.description: • meta - (Optional, map) Key/value pairs that are opaque to Consul and are associated with the intention.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional, string) Optional description that can be used by Consul tooling, but is not used internally.

properties.name: datacenter
properties.description: • datacenter - (Optional) The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: datacenter
properties.description: • datacenter - (Optional) The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

properties.name: token
properties.description: • token - (Optional) The ACL token to use. This overrides the token that the agent provides by default.

properties.name: key
properties.description: • key - (Required) Specifies a key in Consul to be written. Supported values documented below.
The key block supports the following:

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) This is the path in Consul that should be written to.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) The value to write to the given path.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: • flags - (Optional) An unsigned integer value to attach to the key (defaults to 0).

properties.name: delete
properties.description: • delete - (Optional) If true, then the key will be deleted when either its configuration block is removed from the configuration or the entire resource is destroyed. Otherwise, it will be left in Consul. Defaults to false.

properties.name: deprecated-key-arguments
properties.description: » Deprecated key arguments

Prior to Terraform 0.7, this resource was used both to read and write the Consul key/value store. The read functionality has moved to the consul_keys data source, whose documentation can be found via the navigation.
The pre-0.7 interface for reading keys is still supported for backward compatibility, but will be removed in a future version of Terraform.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: datacenter
properties.description: • datacenter - (Optional) The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

properties.name: token
properties.description: • token - (Optional) The ACL token to use. This overrides the token that the agent provides by default.

properties.name: path_prefix
properties.description: • path_prefix - (Required) Specifies the common prefix shared by all keys that will be managed by this resource instance. In most cases this will end with a slash, to manage a "folder" of keys.

properties.name: subkeys
properties.description: • subkeys - (Optional) A mapping from subkey name (which will be appended to the given path_prefix) to the value that should be stored at that key. Use slashes, as shown in the above example, to create "sub-folders" under the given path prefix.

properties.name: subkey
properties.description: • subkey - (Optional) A subkey to add. Supported values documented below. Multiple blocks supported.
The subkey block supports the following:

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) This is the path (which will be appended to the given path_prefix) in Consul that should be written to.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) The value to write to the given path.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: • flags - (Optional) An unsigned integer value to attach to the key (defaults to 0).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Required) The address of the node being added to, or referenced in the catalog.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the node being added to, or referenced in the catalog.

properties.name: datacenter
properties.description: • datacenter - (Optional) The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

properties.name: meta
properties.description: • meta - (Optional, map) Key/value pairs that are associated with the node.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: datacenter
properties.description: • datacenter - (Optional) The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

properties.name: token
properties.description: • token - (Optional) The ACL token to use when saving the prepared query. This overrides the token that the agent provides by default.

properties.name: stored_token
properties.description: • stored_token - (Optional) The ACL token to store with the prepared query. This token will be used by default whenever the query is executed.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the prepared query. Used to identify the prepared query during requests. Can be specified as an empty string to configure the query as a catch-all.

properties.name: service
properties.description: • service - (Required) The name of the service to query.

properties.name: session
properties.description: • session - (Optional) The name of the Consul session to tie this query's lifetime to. This is an advanced parameter that should not be used without a complete understanding of Consul sessions and the implications of their use (it is recommended to leave this blank in nearly all cases). If this parameter is omitted the query will not expire.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) The list of required and/or disallowed tags. If a tag is in this list it must be present. If the tag is preceded with a "!" then it is disallowed.

properties.name: only_passing
properties.description: • only_passing - (Optional) When true, the prepared query will only return nodes with passing health checks in the result.

properties.name: connect
properties.description: • connect - (Optional) When true the prepared query will return connect proxy services for a queried service. Conditions such as tags in the prepared query will be matched against the proxy service. Defaults to false.

properties.name: near
properties.description: • near - (Optional) Allows specifying the name of a node to sort results near using Consul's distance sorting and network coordinates. The magic _agent value can be used to always sort nearest the node servicing the request.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: failover - (Optional) Options for controlling behavior when no healthy nodes are available in the local DC.

properties.name: nearest_n
properties.description: (Optional) Return results from this many datacenters, sorted in ascending order of estimated RTT.

properties.name: datacenters
properties.description: (Optional) Remote datacenters to return results from.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: dns - (Optional) Settings for controlling the DNS response details.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: (Optional) The TTL to send when returning DNS results.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: template - (Optional) Query templating options. This is used to make a single prepared query respond to many different requests.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of template matching to perform. Currently only name_prefix_match is supported.

properties.name: regexp
properties.description: (Required) The regular expression to match with. When using name_prefix_match, this regex is applied against the query name.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required, string) The name of the service.

properties.name: node
properties.description: • node - (Required, string) The name of the node the to register the service on.

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Optional, string) The address of the service. Defaults to the address of the node.

properties.name: service_id
properties.description: • service_id (Optional, string) - If the service ID is not provided, it will be defaulted to the value of the name attribute.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Optional, int) The port of the service.

properties.name: checks
properties.description: • checks - (Optional, list of checks) Health-checks to register to monitor the service. The list of attributes for each health-check is detailled below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional, set of strings) A list of values that are opaque to Consul, but can be used to distinguish between services or nodes.

properties.name: datacenter
properties.description: • datacenter - (Optional) The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

properties.name: meta
properties.description: • meta - (Optional) A map of arbitrary KV metadata linked to the service instance.
The following attributes are available for each health-check:

properties.name: check_id
properties.description: (Optional, string) An ID, unique per agent. Will default to name if not set.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the health-check.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: (Optional, string) An opaque field meant to hold human readable text.

properties.name: status
properties.description: (Optional, string) The initial health-check status.

properties.name: tcp
properties.description: (Optional, string) The TCP address and port to connect to for a TCP check.

properties.name: http
properties.description: (Optional, string) The HTTP endpoint to call for an HTTP check.

properties.name: header
properties.description:
(Optional, set of headers) The headers to send for an HTTP check.
The attributes of each header is given below.

properties.name: tls_skip_verify
properties.description: (Optional, boolean) Whether to deactivate certificate verification for HTTP health-checks. Defaults to false.

properties.name: method
properties.description: (Optional, string) The method to use for HTTP health-checks. Defaults to GET.

properties.name: interval
properties.description:
(Required, string) The interval to wait between each health-check
invocation.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Required, string) The timeout value for HTTP checks.

properties.name: deregister_critical_service_after
properties.description: (Optional, string) The time after which the service is automatically deregistered when in the critical state. Defaults to 30s.
Each header must have the following attributes: * name - (Required, string) The name of the header. * value - (Required, list of strings) The header's list of values.
